comment._content: Limerick City Library have a great set of online articles and book extracts on the opera singer Catherine Hayes: www.limerickcity.ie/Library/LocalStudies/LocalStudiesFile...

comment.author: 57139267@N06
comment._content: Just out of shot on the left is Irwin Bros. at No. 22 Patrick Street - Est. 1897, closed 20 April 2011. See www.limerickleader.ie/news/business/sadness_as_limerick_c...

comment.author: 57139267@N06
comment._content: Can anyone tell me anything about James Smyth (with a Y) whose business at No. 29 was advertised by the famous giant boot? As noted above, he appears in city directories at this address from 1870 to 1920. Was James related to the Smith brothers (with an I) who were in business around the corner on William Street and Sarsfield Street around the same time - George and Richard? Another of their brothers, John, has an address in Patrick Street in an 1894 deed, but had several businesses in Adare. No. 29 was not inhabited for either the 1901 or 1911 census. Where did James Smyth live? Obviously not over his shop. When did he die? Is this him - Smyth James 18/04/1907 Clareville, Lansdowne funeral report? See www.limerickcity.ie/Library/LocalStudies/Obituariesdeathn...

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: According to this document, In 1902, the public and private lighting system of the city began the transition from gas to electricity. ... By the late 1920s, the city’s public and private lighting systems were powered both by gas and by electricity.
